questions.question_text:
When using Workspace ONE 20.x and higher, which three ways can an administrator using UEM automatically move devices into specified organization groups?
(Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
When configuring user and group settings for Directory Service integration, the following two pieces of information are typically needed:

A. Base DN (Distinguished Name): The Base DN defines the starting point in the directory tree where the search for users and groups begins. It helps specify the location in the directory where user and group objects are stored.

D. User & Group Object Class: These object classes define the types of objects in the directory that represent users and groups. You need to specify the object classes used in your directory to ensure proper identification of users and groups during integration.

The other options listed (B, C, and E) may be relevant in other contexts, but they are not typically required when configuring user and group settings for Directory Service integration.

Answer: A and D
See: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Workspace-ONE-UEM/2212/Directory_Service_Integration/GUID-DirSvcSetUpDirectoryServicesManually.html

questions.question_text: Which Workspace ONE UEM feature helps device users perform automated tasks across multiple business backend systems within VMware applications?

Administrators have noticed that all iOS devices are not checking into Workspace ONE in their SaaS environment. They are also unable to send any push notifications to the iOS devices. However, Android and Windows devices are working fine.

What can the administrator do to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
As the issue is 100% iOS related, the issue looks like something with APNs.

Selected Answer: C
The issue described pertains to iOS devices not checking into Workspace ONE and push notifications not being sent. This is typically related to the Apple Push Notification Service (APNs) certificate, as iOS devices rely on APNs for communication. Therefore, the administrator should:

C. Make sure that the APNs certificate is valid and not expired.

The APNs certificate is crucial for iOS device communication with Workspace ONE, and if it's invalid or has expired, it can result in the described issues. Ensuring that the APNs certificate is valid and up-to-date should help resolve the problem with iOS devices not checking in or receiving push notifications.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C.
APNS Cert validity

Selected Answer: C
If Windows and Android devices are working, but iOS ones aren't, it should be APNs Cert validity.

"C"
https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/80596

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer is C.
APNS Cert validity

choices.A: Make sure that the Rest API and SOAP API certificate are valid.
choices.B: Make sure that all SSL certificates used for the Workspace ONE environment are valid.
choices.C: Make sure that the APNs certificate is valid and not expired.
choices.D: Make sure that the Email Notification Service v2 is configured.
